2107850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107850
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 001
2107850.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "None of you should fast a day or two before the (beginning of the) mouth of Ramadan, unless it is a day on which one is in the habit of fasting (i.e. voluntary fasting that coincides with that day).” Agreed upon.

2107860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107860
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 002
2107860.text: ’Ammar bin Yasir (RAA) narrated, ‘Whoever fasts the day of doubt he has then disobeyed Abu al-Qasim (the Prophet).’ Related by the five Imams, and Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih

2107870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107870
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 003
2107870.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say, "Start fasting after you have seen it (i.e. the new crescent) and end the fast (at the end of the month) when you see it. If it is overcast and cannot be seen, then estimate its sighting (i.e. presume that Sha‘ban lasted for thirty days)." Agreed upon. Muslim narrated, "If it is too overcast to be seen then presume that it (Sha'ban) lasted for thirty days."In another narration by al-Bukhari, "wait, until thirty days of it (Sha’ban) have passed."

2107900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107900
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 004
2107900.text: Al-Bukhari reported on the authority of Abu Hurairah, “Complete the days of Sha’ban as thirty days.”

2107910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107910
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 005
2107910.text: Ibn ’Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘The people were trying to sight the new moon (of Ramadan.) and when I reported to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) that I had seen it, he fasted and commanded people to fast.’ Related by Abu Dawud, and Al-Hakim and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih.

2107920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107920
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 006
2107920.text: Ibn ‘Abbas (RAA) narrated, ‘A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said, ‘I have sighted the crescent (of Ramadan). He then said to him, "Do you testify that there is none worthy of worship but Allah?” The Bedouin said, ‘Yes.’ He asked him again, "Do you testify that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)?" The man replied, ‘Yes.’ The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) there upon said, "O Bilal! Announce to the people to (start) fasting tomorrow." Related by the five Imams. Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih. An-Nasa'i said that it is most probably Mursal (a Hadith in which the link between the Successor (Tabi’i) and the Prophet (ﷺ) is missing.

2107930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107930
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 007
2107930.text: The mother of the believers, Hafsah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever does not form his intention to fast before to fajr, his fasting will not be accepted.” Related by the five Imams, but At-Tirmidhi and An-Nasa’i consider it to be related by Hafsah and not connected to the Prophet (ﷺ). Imam Ad-Daraqutni transmitted, "No fasting is accepted for one who does not form the intention (to fast) the night before.”

2107950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107950
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 008
2107950.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, ‘One day the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered my house and said, “ls there anything here (to eat)?" I said, ‘NO,’ He said, “I shall then be fasting (today)." Then he came to us another day and we said to him, 'Someone has offered us some hais as a gift.’ He then said, "Show it to me. I had been fasting since this morning, “and he ate from it ( as it was a voluntary fast and not during the obligatory fasting of Ramadan). Related by Muslim.

2107960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107960
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 009
2107960.text: Sahl bin Sa'd (RAA) narrated That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "People will always be fine (on the right path, or following the Sunnah) as long as they hasten to break their fast (in Ramadan)." Agreed upon.

2107970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107970
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 010
2107970.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Allah, the Most Exalted said: “Those among My servants, who hasten to break their fast, are the most beloved (or dearest)to Me.” Related by At-Tirmidhi.

2107980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107980
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 011
2107980.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Eat the suhur (pre-dawn meal), for there are blessings in this meal.” Agreed upon.

2107990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2107990
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 012
2107990.text: Sulaiman bin ’Amir Ad-Dabbi (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When one of you is breaking his fast, he should eat some dates. If dates are not available, then break it with some water, for water is purifying.’’ Related by the five lmams. Ibn Khuzaimah, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2108000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108000
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 013
2108000.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade us from practicing wisal in fasting (i.e. fasting continuously without breaking one’s fast in the evening or eating before the following dawn). So a man said to him, ‘But you practice wisal O Messenger of Allah!’ The Prophet Allah (ﷺ) replied, “Which one of you is like me? I am given food and drink during my sleep by Allah." So when people refused to stop wisal, the Prophet fasted day and night continuously along with them for a day and then another day and then they saw the crescent (of the new month of Shawwal). The Prophet said to them, "If the crescent had not appeared, I would have made you fast for a longer period." That was a punishment for them because they refused to stop (practicing Wisal). Agreed upon.

2108010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108010
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 014
2108010.text: Abu Hurairah (BAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever does not give up forged speech and evil actions and does not abandon foolishness, Allah is not in need of his leaving food and drink (i.e. Allah will not accept his FASTING).” Related by Al-Bukhari and Abu Dawud, and the wording is from the latter.

2108020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108020
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 015
2108020.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would kiss and embrace (his wives) while fasting, for he had the most control of all of you over his desires.’ Agreed upon and the wording is from Muslim, who added in a narration, ‘In Ramadan.

2108040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108040
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 016
2108040.text: Ibn 'Abbas (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had himself cupped while he was in a state of Ihram, and had himself cupped while he was fasting.’’ Related by Al-Bukhari.

2108050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108050
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 017
2108050.text: Shaddad bin Aus (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came across a man in Al-Baqi' (in Madinah) who was having himself cupped in Ramadan., and said to him, “The one who cups and the one who is being cupped have both broken their fast." Related by the five Imams except for At-Tirmidhi. Ahmad, Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn Hibban regarded it as authentic.

2108060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108060
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 018
2108060.text: Anas (RAA) narrated, ‘The first time cupping was dis-liked for the one who is fasting was when Ja’far bin Abi Talib had himself cupped while fasting and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came across him and said, "Those two have broken their fast (meaning Ja'far and the man who was cupping him.)" But later on the Prophet allowed cupping for the one who is fasting. Anas used to have himself cupped while he was fasting. Related by Ad-Daraqutni, who regarded it as a strong hadith.

2108070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108070
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 019
2108070.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) applied kohl to his eyes while he was fasting.’ Related by Ibn Majah with a weak chain of narrators. According to At-Tirmidhi, nothing authentic has been related from the Prophet concerning this issue, i.e. applying kohl, eye drops etc. to the eye while fasting.

2108090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108090
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 020
2108090.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘Whoever forgets that he is fasting, and eats or drinks is to complete his fast, as it was Allah who fed him and gave him something to drink." Agreed upon.

2108100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108100
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 021
2108100.text: Al-Hakim transmitted on the authority of Abu Hurairah, “Whoever breaks his fast during Ramadan due to forgetfulness is not to make up for the day later or perform an expiation.” It is a sound hadith.

2108110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108110
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 022
2108110.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever is overcome and vomits is not to make up for the day, but whoever vomits intentionally must make up the day.” Related by the five Imams.

2108140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108140
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 023
2108140.text: Jabir (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) left for Makkah during the year of the conquest (of Makkah) in Ramadan and he and the people with him fasted until he reached the valley of Kura Al-Ghamim. He then called for a cup of water, which he elevated so that the people could see it, and then he drank. After-wards, he was told that some people had continued to fast, and he then said, "Those are the disobedient ones! Those are the disobedient ones!”

2108150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108150
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 024
2108150.text: In another narration, ‘He was told that people are finding it difficult to fast (during the journey) and they are waiting to see what the Prophet (ﷺ) will do. So he called for a cup of water after the Asr (afternoon) prayer and drank it.’ Related by Muslim.

2108160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108160
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 025
2108160.text: Hamzah bin ’Amro Al-Aslami (RAA) narrated, ‘I said to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)! I find within me the strength to fast while traveling. Would there be any blame upon me if I were to do so?’ The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him, "It is a concession from Allah. Whoever takes it has done well. Whoever likes to fast, there is no blame upon him."Related by Muslim.

2108170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108170
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 026
2108170.text: And it's basic meaning is in Al-Bukhari and Muslim from the narration of Aisha (with the wording) "that Hamza bin 'Amro asked".

2108180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108180
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 027
2108180.text: Ibn ’Abbas (RAA) narrated, ‘An elderly man is permitted to break his fast, but he must feed a poor person daily, and he does not have to make up for it.’ Related by Ad-Daraqutni and Al- hakim, who rendered it to be Sahih

2108190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108190
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 028
2108190.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that A man came to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said, “l am ruined O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)!" The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked him, “What has ruined you?" The man replied, ‘I had intercourse with my wife during the day in Ramadan while fasting)’ The Prophet said to him, "Are you able to free a slave?" The man said, ‘No.’ The Prophet said, "Can you fast for two consecutive months?" He said, ‘NO.' The Prophet then asked him, "Can you provide food for sixty poor people?" He said, ‘No.’ Then the man sat down. A basket of dates was brought to the Prophet and he said to the man, “Give this as Sadaqah (voluntary charity)” The man said, ‘To someone who is poorer than us!’ There is no one in this city (Al-Madinah) who is in need of these dates more than us!’ The Prophet laughed until his molar teeth could be seen and said to the man, “Go and feed your family with these dates.” Related by the seven Imams and the wording is from Muslim.

2108200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108200
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 029
2108200.text: 'A’isha and Umm Salamah (RAA) narrated, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would rise in the morning (when it is already Fajr time) while he was Junub (in a state of major ritual impurity due to intercourse) on a day in Ramadan. He would then perform Ghusl and fast. Agreed upon. In the narration of Muslim on the authority of Umm Salamah, ‘And he would not make up for it (that day).’

2108220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108220
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 030
2108220.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever dies while he still has some fasts to make up (of the days of Ramadan), then his heir (any of them) should fast on his behalf.” Agreed upon.

2108230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108230
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 031
2108230.text: Abu Qatadah Al-Ansari (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was asked about fasting on the day of Arafah (the 9th of the month of Dhul Hijjah). He replied, "Fasting on the day of Arafah is an expiation for the preceding year and the following year.” He was also asked about fasting on the day of Ashura (the 10th of the month of Muharram). He replied, “Fasting on the day of Ashura is an expiation for the preceding year.” The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was also asked about fasting on Monday, and he replied, "This is the day on which I was born and the day on which I was sent (with the Message of Islam) and the day on which I received revelation." Related by Muslim.

2108240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108240
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 032
2108240.text: Abu Aiyub Al-Ansari (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever fasts during the month of Ramadan and then follows it with six days of Shawwal will be (rewarded) as if he had fasted the entire year." Related by Muslim.

2108250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108250
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 033
2108250.text: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “No servant (of Allah) fasts on a day (merely) for the sake of Allah except that Allah pushes the Hellfire seventy years further away from his face, due to fasting on this day.” Agreed upon and the wording is from Muslim.

2108260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108260
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 034
2108260.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to fast until one would say, he never breaks his fast (i.e. he never stops fasting), and he would abandon fasting (at other times) until one would say that he never fasts. And I never saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) fast for a complete month except for the month of Ramadan, and I never saw him fast in a month more than he did in the month of Sha’ban.” Agreed upon and the wording is from Muslim.

2108270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108270
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 035
2108270.text: Abu Dharr (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to fast for three days of every month; that is on the days of the full moon; the 13th , 14th , and 15th (of the lunar month).’ Related by An-Nasa’i and At-Tirmidhi and rendered authentic by Ibn Hibban.

2108280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108280
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 036
2108280.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah said, "A woman is not to fast (even) for one day while her husband is present except with his permission" Agreed upon and the wording is from Al-Bukhari. Abu Dawud’s version states, “unless it is during Ramadan (then she does not need his permission as it is obligatory fasting).’’

2108300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108300
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 037
2108300.text: Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RAA) narrated. ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) has prohibited fasting on two days; the day of Fitr (breaking the fast of Ramadan) and on the day of sacrifice ('Idul Adha).’ Agreed upon.

2108310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108310
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 038
2108310.text: Nubaishah Al-Hudhali (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The days of Tashriq (the three days following 'Idul Ad-ha, i.e. 11th , 12th and 13th of Dhul Hijjah) are days of eating, drinking and remembering (dhikr) of Allah, the Most Great and Glorious." Related by Muslim.

2108320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108320
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 039
2108320.text: 'A’isha and lbn 'Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘Nobody was allowed to fast on the days of Tashriq except for those, who could not afford the Hadi (sacrifice).' Related by Al-Bukhari.

2108330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108330
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 040
2108330.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not single out Friday night (i.e. the night preceding Friday) among all the other nights for performing the night prayer. Also, do not single out Friday among other days for fasting, unless it coincides with the days one regularly fasts." Related by Muslim.

2108340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108340
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 041
2108340.text: Abu Hurairah, narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “None of you should fast on Friday, unless he fasts together with the day before or the day after.” Agreed upon.

2108350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108350
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 042
2108350.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When it is the middle of Sha'ban do not fast (until it is Ramadan).” Related by the five Imams, but Imam Ahmad declared it to be a weak narration.

2108360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108360
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 043
2108360.text: As-Samma’ bint Busr (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not fast on Saturday unless it is an obligatory fast. (Do not fast) even if you do not find anything (to eat) except for some grape peelings or the branch of a tree, in that case he should chew on it." Related by the five Imams and its narrators are reliable. Imam Malik disapproved this narration, and Abu Dawud said that this narration is abrogated.

2108390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108390
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 044
2108390.text: Umm Salamah (RAA) narrated, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to fast more often on Saturdays and Sundays than on the other days. He would say, "They are the 'ids of the polytheists, and I love to act contrary to what they do." Related by An-Nasal and was rendered authentic by Ibn Khuzaimah, and the wording is his.

2108400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108400
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 045
2108400.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade fasting on the day of Arafah for the one who is actually at Arafah (i.e. performing Hajj). Related by the five Imams except for At-Tirmidhi. Ibn Khuzaimah and al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2108410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108410
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 046
2108410.text: ’Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “May he, who perpetually fasts (without a break) never fast." Agreed upon.

2108420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108420
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 047
2108420.text: Muslim narrated on the authority of Abu Qatadah, “May he not fast or break his fast."

2108430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108430
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 048
2108430.text: Abu Hurairah narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever prays during the night in Ramadan out of sincere faith and seeking its reward from Allah, will have all of his previous sins forgiven." Agreed upon.

2108440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108440
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 049
2108440.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, ‘With the start of the last ten days of Ramadan, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to tighten his waist belt (i.e. keep away from his wives) and used to stay up praying all night, and he would also wake his wives (to pray and recite Qur’an etc..).” Agreed upon.

2108450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108450
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 050
2108450.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, ’The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to perform I'tikaf during the last ten days of Ramadan until he died. Then his wives used to perform I'tikaf after his death.’ Agreed upon.

2108460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108460
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 051
2108460.text: ’A’isha (RAA) narrated, "Whenever the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) intended to make I'tikaf he would pray the morning prayer and then he would enter the place of his I’tikaf (i.e. the place, which he had prepared for his I'tikaf inside the mosque)." Agreed upon.

2108470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108470
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 052
2108470.text: ’A’isha (RAA) narrated, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to put his head into (the window of my house) while he was in the mosque (performing I'tikaf) and I would comb his hair. When he was in I'tikaf he would not enter the house except for some need.”Agreed upon and the wording is from Al-Bukhari.

2108480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108480
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 053
2108480.text: ’A’isha (RAA) narrated, ‘It is Sunnah for the one performing I'tikaf not to visit the sick, attend a funeral, or touch his wife (with sexual desire), nor have sexual intercourse with her. He should also not go out (of the mosque) except for an extreme necessity, and no I’tikaf is accepted without fasting, or without being in a congregational mosque (where Friday prayer is performed).’ Related by Abu Dawud with an acceptable chain of narrators, but scholars say that the last part (starting: ‘no I'tikaf is accepted….) is most probably the saying of ’A’isha (RAA), i.e. Hadith Mauquf (i.e. that which the companion does not connect to the Prophet and it is not the Prophet (ﷺ) himself.

2108490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108490
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 054
2108490.text: Ibn ’Abbas (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: The one who is performing I'tikaf does not have to fast unless he obliges himself to do so.” Related by Ad-Daraqutni and al-Hakim, and most probably it is also the saying of Ibn 'Abbas, i.e. Mawquf and not of the sayings of the Prophet (ﷺ).

2108500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108500
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 055
2108500.text: Ibn ’Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘Some of the companions of the Prophet were shown in their dreams that the night of Qadr was in the last seven nights of Ramadan. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to them, “It seems that all of your dreams agree that (the Night of Qadr) is in the last seven nights, and whoever wants to seek that night should do so in the last seven nights (of Ramadan)." Agreed upon.

2108510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108510
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 056
2108510.text: Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufian (RAA) narrated, ’The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said regarding the night of al-Qadr, "It is the 27th night (of Ramadan).’’ Related by Abu Dawud. But it is most probably the saying of Mu’awiyah and not the Prophet (ﷺ).

2108530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108530
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 057
2108530.text: 'A’isha (RAA) narrated, ‘I asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), if I know what night the night of Qadr is, what should I say during it?’ He said, “Say: O Allah, You are the Pardoner and You love to pardon, so pardon me." Related by the five Imams except for Abu Dawud. At-Tirmidhi and Al-Hakim reported it as Sahih.

2108540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2108540
In-book reference  : Book 5, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 5, Hadith 058
2108540.text: Abu Sa 'id AI-Khudri (RAA) narrated that The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “One should not undertake journeys except to three mosques: al-Masque al-Haram (in Makkah ), the Aqsa mosque, or this mosque (in Madinah)." Agreed upon.
